results.title: The Norman conquests. Part 3. Round and round the garden
results.creator_credit: Thames Television, Verity Lambert, David Susskind and Herbert Wise
results.brief_description: Based on Alan Ayckbourn’s West End trilogy “The Norman conquests” and adapted for television, part three of the trilogy, “Round and round the garden” sees most of the drama set in the garden with a furtive Norman (Tom Conti) doing his best to spirit Annie away, Reg and Tom speculating on Norman’s secretive love-life and Ruth (Norman’s wife) happily sunbathing. The trilogy takes place over a weekend in the family’s country house and features the same six characters in each play. Each story is played out through different eyes but the three plays together form the whole picture. Complex plot but contains some wonderful moments of wit and humour. Stars Richard Briers, Penelope Keith, David Troughton, Fiona Walker, Penelope Wilton.

results.title: The Norman conquests. Part 2. Living together
results.creator_credit: Thames Television, Verity Lambert, David Susskind and Herbert Wise
results.brief_description: Based on Alan Ayckbourn’s West End trilogy “The Norman conquests” and adapted for television, part two of the trilogy, “Living together” sees the irrepressible Norman (Tom Conti) continuing his pursuit of the various women in his family including his sister-in-law, his brother-in-law’s wife and his own wife. The trilogy takes place over a weekend in the family’s country house and features the same six characters in each play. Each story is played out through different eyes but the three plays together form the whole picture. Complex plot but contains some wonderful moments of wit and humour. Stars Richard Briers, Penelope Keith, David Troughton, Fiona Walker, Penelope Wilton.

The trilogy takes place over a weekend in the family’s country house and features the same six characters in each play. Stars Richard Briers, Penelope Keith, David Troughton, Fiona Walker, Penelope Wilton.

results.title: The Normal stomach: fluoroscopic observations
results.creator_credit: Medical Audio-Visual Institute, Association of American Medical Colleges and Norman Schenker

results.title: The Normal neonate (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre and George Pashuk
results.brief_description: Examination of a normal infant by a leading paediatrician. It encompasses the six stages of consciousness, the senses of sight and hearing, gross motor functions, and the primitive reflexes.

results.title: The Noisy underwater world of the Weddell seal
results.creator_credit: William Claiborne Incorporated and William L. Claiborne

results.title: The Noise was deafening
results.creator_credit: Millbank Films, David Evans and Peter Rawson
results.brief_description: This film is a safety education film and is designed to make both management and employees aware of the irreversible effects of excessive noise, to show how noise surveys should be carried out, and to highlight some of the methods by which excessive noise can be reduced.

results.title: The Noise invasion
results.brief_description: Fascinating exploration of the deleterious effects to health of excessive environmental noise. This noise is traced to its principal sources - in transport and industry - and technological and legislative approaches for its reduction are examined. Points out that industrial noise is causing permanent deafness in millions of people and shows the results of research.

results.title: The Ninth gate
results.brief_description: Legendary director Roman Polanski subtly intertwines his trademark themes of gothic, supernatural excess with hints of suspense and humour to deliver a provocative and atmospheric screen adaptation of Arturo Perez Reverte’s 1993 best-selling novel, “El Club Dumas”. Unscrupulous rare book broker Dean Corso gets more than he has bargained for after he is hired by multimillionaire Boris Balkan to authenticate a volume of The Nine Gates of the Kingdom of Shadows, a priceless seventeenth century occult text whose woodcut images, when assembled correctly, are rumoured to have the power to summon the Devil. Dispatched to Europe to hunt down the only two other copies known to exist, Corso soon finds himself enmeshed in a mystery of epic proportions as he follows a trail of clues, encounters eccentric bibliophiles, is relentlessly pursued by a widening circle of deadly foes and is rescued by an enigmatic and ubiquitous green-eyed beauty. As the people he has been dealing with in relation to the book begin to die under bizarre circumstances, Corso must locate the missing images, both to save his own skin and to resolve his own growing obsession with the arcane legend of the book. Stars Johnny Depp as Corso, Frank Langella as Boris Balkan, Lena Olin as Liana Telfer, and Emmanuelle Seigner as The Girl.
